design: Pre-FEED, FEED, Detailed Design, Procurement, Demolition, Construction Support
discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation, Controls and Procurement
location: Outside Fort St. John, BC – Brownfield
description: The redevelopment of an existing 100 MMSCFD sour gas facility was managed by Denali to accommodate new producer gas volumes. A key requirement of the project was upgrading the existing electrical infrastructure to support the new 4160V refrigeration compressor and overheads compressor motors. Three 1.3 MW generators were added to the facility, integrated into a new 5 kV E-house, with a design that allows for a future utility connection. This project focused on providing a reliable and fit-for-service off-grid power generation solution that meets the client's budgetary needs.

discipline: Electrical & Controls, Instrumentation, Mechanical Support, Process Support
description: This project, currently in the final phases of construction, is a greenfield sour gas plant near Grande Prairie. To ensure reliability, the power distribution design of the facility includes a 25 kV substation supplying utility power, along with a 4.6 MW gas turbine generator and a 1.3 MW steam turbine generator. A custom power management system has been developed to parallel the generators with the grid and utilizes a fast-acting load-shedding system to keep the facility online during utility outages.

project: : Compressor Station Plant Relocate and Power Generation Addition
description: Our client upgraded the capacity of an existing compressor station to increase gas throughput to 25 MMSCFD. To power the new process equipment, a generator package consisting of three 535 kW generators, along with 600 V switchgear, was retrofitted and installed at the facility. Additional modifications, including a custom feeder breaker and power meter, were made to the generator package to enable the client to sell excess power to a third-party consumer.

Denali provided comprehensive mechanical design services for a power plant capable of generating 1.8 MW of local grid power using LNG and diesel fuels. Three separate 1.8 MW gensets were installed: two utilizing LNG and one using diesel. All engines were equipped with a jacket water heat recovery system to optimize energy efficiency.

project: Diesel Generator Engine and Genset Replacement Program
description: Denali was awarded the Generator Engine and Genset Replacement Program for a client in the Northwest Territories. The scope involved reviewing and replacing two diesel genset engines and two diesel genset packages at four of their existing powerhouse locations. We focused on the mechanical design for replacing these items, which varied in size from 600 to 1,100 kW, all utilizing diesel engines at existing power plants that service the local municipality. The scope included conducting a feasibility review of the replacements and creating construction drawings to ensure that the new engines or gensets could be integrated with existing on-site utilities and infrastructure.

project: 3.6 MW Power Generation as part of 100 MMSCFD Sour Facility Plant Optimization
design: Pre-FEED, FEED, Detailed Design, Procurement, Demolition, Construction Support
discipline: Mechanical, Process, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Instrumentation, Controls and Procurement
location: Outside Fort St. John, BC – Brownfield
description: As part of the redevelopment of an existing 100 MMSCFD sour gas facility designed by Denali, an additional 3.6 MW of power generation was required to accommodate the new medium voltage loads. This was achieved by adding three separate 1.2 MW natural gas engine 4160 V gensets and integrating them into the facility's new medium voltage development plan. Denali was also responsible for modifications to the existing two 1.2 MW low voltage natural gas engine gensets and for redeveloping the power distribution plan. Denali performed the detailed integration, design, construction, and commissioning of these gensets.
